RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 50. Maiden Claiming Purse 10000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROSALIE'S DESTINY was sharp out of the gates, took advantage of the one post position and took the lead along the rail, attended to the pace, was joined by another competitor at the three eighths pole, battled with this challenger past the quarter pole and deep into the stretch, under left handed urging ROSALIE'S DESTINY drifted out a stride and nearly bumped her challenger but was quickly corrected and re focused where she ran on and took the lead for the win. DR. WOODS MIRACLE bumped at the start, was off a step slow and was un hurried, cued at the half mile pole and began to gain ground, shifted close to the rail to save ground through the second turn, advanced up the rail at the quarter pole and was set down for the closing drive, was encouraged and kept on point, finished willingly and was second best today. LEXINGTON DIAMOND was bumped at the start, raced mid pack in the four path, advanced after the five furlong marker, gained ground and improved position, challenged for the lead at the three eighths pole, shifted into the two path and traded blows with the eventual winner into the furlong ground, but tired late while starting to drift in. OLD SCHOOL FLASH vied for the lead, settled into a stalking position on the rail, raced with another foe on her outside, gave way near the quarter pole. BISTINEAU BELLE raced from off of the pace, followed in the three path, had no kick. DANCING TRICK trailed early, improved position late late but made no impact. SENSING GOLD vied for the lead, settled into a satlking position while racing three wide and stopped after the half.

ENTRY.NAME: Rosalie's Destiny
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, set the pace, battled 3/8, drifted out, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Bistineau Belle
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 3w, mid pack, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Lexington Diamond
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, mid pack, 4w, moved 1/2, challenged 3/8, battled, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Dr. Woods Miracle
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, off slow. settled, 3w, rail, closed, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Dancing Trick
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed early, improved position, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Old School Flash
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, rail, flattened out.

ENTRY.NAME: Sensing Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, stalked, 3w, stopped after the half.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 18500. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over On The Turf Since May 17, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, al lowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BAYOU SARGE settled on the rail and raced mid pack, inched into a stalking position willingly and in hands with another horse on the outside, quietly stayed on the rail, improved position through the turn was encouraged and willingly closed up the rail, collared the early leaders after the sixteenth pole and kept on and kicked clear for the win in the last few strides. MR. TIN MAN was three wide and stalking the early leader, was racing next to an inside foe, was joined by another competitor and raced between horsed at the half mile marker, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, was baled to get the lead at the sixteenth pole, was collared by a fast closing rival and had to settle for second place. WESTERN STAR hopped a bit at the start, was off slow, found his stride by the six furlong pole, raced in the three path and gained ground, split horsed and raced in between rivals at the half mile pole, shifted into the four path entering the lane and closed down the lane. THROWIN' SHADE vied for the lead, raced along the rail, attended the pace, with pressure from outside rivals, showed the way until the stretch, then tired late. GENERAL EISENHOWER was four wide, raced from off the pace but had no rally. CHIEFWEAVE stalked the early pace setter while racing in the four path, launched a bid at the five sixteenth pole, drew next to the early leader, matched strides and battled briefly then tired in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Bayou Sarge
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail, mid pack, 2nd tier, closed, collared leader, kicked clear

ENTRY.NAME: Western Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: hoppedstrt,3w, moved 6f, split 1/2, btwn, flattened out

ENTRY.NAME: General Eisenhower
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w, off pace, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Throwin' Shade
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, pace, stlkd, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Chiefweave
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 4w, bid 16th, battled briefly, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Tin Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, stlkd, btwn, bid 3/8, led, battled, second best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 80. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 33000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winner s Of A Race Since May 17, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ZYDECO MUSIC was well off the pace early on, improved position while racing three wide, made one run and gained ground along the outside, shifted into the four path entering the stretch, was encouraged and happily closed in on the leaders while racing down the lane, caught the leaders at the last sixteenth pole, edged clear and drew off for the win. MISS PRIORITY stalked the early pace setter and raced in the two path, patiently waited until the quarter pole where she was joined by an outside rival, and launched a bid with that one to her outside, entered the stretch and gave way to the outside rival, was kept in the game and encouraged, she willingly kept on closing and was able to come away with second place honors. GOLDEN SMILES raced three wide and in the middle of the pack early, was gathered up and starting improving position after the half, was in full swing after the half mile pole, gained ground and improved position through the turn, raced five wide through the stretch and under strong encouragement got up for third place money. DROP DEAD SEXY was sharp out of the gates, established the lead and raced along the rail, set all the early fractions at a brisk pace, was challenged after the quarter pole and gave way. SWEET VIDALIA was off a bit slow, raced on the rail, had horses racing on her outside down the backside, launched a mild bit at the quarter pole. MISS KENNEDY raced off of the pace and in the four path, raced on the out of another competitor down the backside, made no impact. INAWIC settled off of the pace along the rail but was never involved. G'S SQUEEZE trailed through out.

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Vidalia
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, rail, in company, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Inawic
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off the pace, rail, was never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Priority
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2w, stalked, waited, bid, caught by foe, held on

ENTRY.NAME: Drop Dead Sexy
ENTRY.COMMENT: sharp, rail, led, pace, tired

ENTRY.NAME: G's Squeeze
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed through out

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Smiles
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, mid pack, bid 1/2, battled 1/4, 5 wide, upper, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Kennedy
ENTRY.COMMENT: off the pace, 4w, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Zydeco Music
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace, 3w, cued 1/2, improved outside, cleared late, up

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 92. Claiming Purse 16500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE DECEMBER 17, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 17, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 Accredited Arkansas Bred Preferred.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TRAPPE VALLEY stalked the early pace in the two path, patiently waited until after the quarter pole, launched a bid and edged past the early leader to draw off for the win. STOMPING HOTROD raced two wide in the middle of the pack, was joined by an outside foe after the half, improved position in a set, stayed behind horses through the turn and into the stretch, was encouraged dawn the lane and proved to be second best today. TAPIT'S SPIRIT vied for the led, raced on the rail while setting the pace, was challenged through the turn, relinquished the lead, was urged in the stretch and held on for third. D TWO was settled in the three path, raced off of the pace on the outside of another rival, shifted entering the stretch, was angled back into the three and maintained his position until the wire. FAR BEYOND trailed early and made no impact. CARL G showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Tapit's Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, rail, led, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Far Beyond
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed early, made no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Stomping Hotrod
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail, 2w, set 3/8, battled between 8th, second best

ENTRY.NAME: D Two
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2nd tier, 3w, maintained position

ENTRY.NAME: Carl G
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Trappe Valley
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2w, bid 1/4, drew off

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 15000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at one mile and seventy yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DANZIG UP A STORM stalked the early leader in the three path in hands, drew beside of the early leader and matched strides on the lead while being rated past the half and onto the three eighths where he was cued and given his head, drew off by a stride, had pressure from the outside and was encouraged through the rest of the turn, continued to feel the pressure from his outside foe past the quarter pole, struggled to switch leads but finally did at the eighth pole then on a fresh leg drew away and won easily. SWIZZLECITY was five wide racing through the first turn, was well off the pace, was asked and responded well by gaining ground and building momentum past the half mile marker, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, and past horses through the turn, loomed up near the eventual winner entering the stretch, chased down the lane, was second best today. SUE'S LITTLE ZING vied for the early lead, raced on the rail, set the pace, was challenged and matched strides from the half until the three eighths, relinquished the lead at the quarter pole but held sway for third. ZEEROCK was near the back and raced off the pace, settled in hands and found her best stride at the half mile pole, smartly saved ground, passed horsed through the turn on the fence, angled out into the six path in the stretch was encouraged and closed well but had too much to do. AVENDORE was off a step slow, raced three wide, improved position and making a mild bid through the stretch drive. HALF SCOUT raced on the rail in the middle of the pack and was able to maintained her position through out. STORMY SUNRISE raced in the middle of the field of competitors, was in contention at the half mile pole, gave way. THAT YOU MARGARET was five wide going into the first turn, shifted into the three path but made no impact. HONEST ANGUS was mid pack early on, raced three wide, was hand ridden down the back side and drew within striking distance, then faltered. KITIARA was forwardly placed early then quit.

ENTRY.NAME: Half Scout
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail trip, maintained position through out

ENTRY.NAME: Kitiara
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed, quit

ENTRY.NAME: Sue's Little Zing
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, pace, matched1/2,relinquished3/8,held on for third

ENTRY.NAME: Danzig Up a Storm
ENTRY.COMMENT: stlkd, 3w, matched 1/2, rated, bid3/8,urged,switched8th,drewoff

ENTRY.NAME: Honest Angus
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 3w, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Stormy Sunrise
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, in contention, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Zeerock
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, settled, rail, saved ground, shifted out 1/4, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Avendore
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slw, improved position 3w, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Swizzlecity
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5 wide first turn, well off the pace, bid 1/2, bid 3/8, chsd, 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: That You Margaret
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5w, 3w, no impact

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 64. Claiming Purse 11000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PREACH IT GIRL raced mid pack and five wide on the bit, willingly raced past the early leaders while being wide through the turn, kicked clear at the quarter pole and continued on for a game win. GUEST IN MY HEART was mid pack and four wide early, moved at the half mile pole, followed the eventual winner and raced wide while circling the field in the turn, chased the winner down the lane but was second best today. JAZLA was stalking the front runners from the inside of horses, stayed on the rail and saved ground, had a well timed trip closed up the fence through the turn and down the stretch, got up for third. THURSDAY MORNING was racing off of the pace in the four path, launched a closing bid at the half mile marker, angled out seven wide in the lane and improved position. KANCANCUTIE was in a stalking position two and three wide, advanced and improved placement after the half mile pole, raced in between foes moving into the the turn, got in tight and checked a bit losing ground, then gave way. SODDY DAISY raced from off of the pace and three wide, showed little. OUR CLOVER GAL trailed and made a mild improvement. RESPECT ALL vied for the lead, established her place on the rail, was pressured by horses to her outside, set the pace with company, then gave way. SIMPERING SMILE stalked, surged up to the lead in the three path, set pace in company and gave way late. ICONIC BONNET vied for the lead, raced in between horsed as they set the pace in a group, gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Respect All
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, rail, in company, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Our Clover Gal
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, mild improvement

ENTRY.NAME: Soddy Daisy
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pce, 3w, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Jazla
ENTRY.OWNER: Bockman Cindy and Nicks Ralph E
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, rail, raced inside of foes, well timed, saved ground, 3r

ENTRY.NAME: Kancancutie
ENTRY.OWNER: Murrah, Mike and Wright, Jack B.
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, advanced 1/2, btwn, checked 3/8, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Thursday Morning
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pcae, 4w, bid 1/2, angled 7w, stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Iconic Bonnet
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied let, btwn horsed, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Preach It Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 5w, advanced 1/2, bid 3/8, led 1/4, held on for the win

ENTRY.NAME: Guest in My Heart
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4w, moved 1/2, shifted 6w, followed eventual winner

ENTRY.NAME: Simpering Smile
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, 3w, pace, in company gave way

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 93. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 33000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since M ay 17, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PICKENS stalked from the inside in the three path, challenged for the lead with pressure to his outside at the quarter pole, continued to match strides and battle with a rival who was racing on the rail all the way through the stretch, was encouraged and finally drew off and cleared his rival late. SCARLETTSBLACKJACK vied for the lead, raced on the rail, set the early fractions, was challenged for the lead by an outside contender at the quarter pole, battled down the stretch, matched strides until the end but came up short. G'WILDCAT raced in the middle of the field was bale to maintain position through out. COHERE raced on the rail and made a mild bid late. KINGOFBROKENHEARTS showed little. OUR FREDDIE MAC flashed speed early then faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Cohere
ENTRY.COMMENT: mild bid late

ENTRY.NAME: Scarlettsblackjack
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, rail, pace, battled, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Pickens
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, challenged 1/4, matched and battled, edged clearlate

ENTRY.NAME: Kingofbrokenhearts
ENTRY.OWNER: Roe Steve D and Roe Patricia L
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Our Freddie Mac
ENTRY.COMMENT: flashed speed and faltered

ENTRY.NAME: G'wildcat
ENTRY.COMMENT: raced mid pack, and maintained position

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 8 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 82. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 17, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 17, 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race ov er the turf course, it will be run on the main track at one mile and seventy yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SEIZE THE TREASURE stalked the leader from the two path, drew next to the pace setter and helped with the pace, took over at the quarter pole and drew off for the easy win. WAR COUNT vied for the lead position, raced on the rail, attended the pace, pressured by an outside foe, relinquished the lead at the quarter pole, continued on down the lane chasing, second best. STEAL IT BACK stalked the pace setter, raced in between foes with pressure from the outside, was asked nearing the three eighths pole but had no kick but was able to hold on to third. FREIGHTRAINFREEMAN stalked while racing two wide, maintained position then gave way late. FIFTEEN LOVE BACK was never involved. POP LIFE trailed early and made no impact. CROQUE MONSIEUR (GB) showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Pop Life
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Croque Monsieur (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Steal It Back
ENTRY.COMMENT: stlkd, btwn, held on

ENTRY.NAME: Fifteen Love Back
ENTRY.COMMENT: was never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Seize the Treasure
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, took over stretch drew off

ENTRY.NAME: War Count
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, rail, chased

ENTRY.NAME: Freightrainfreeman
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2w, gave way
